title: Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | SB 1.12.34 part 2 | 14-09-2022
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Then we can just imagine the amount of sins committed consciously or unconsciously by the untrained population of the Kali Yuga who have no way to perform sacrifice to please the Supreme Lord.
segments.summary: The speaker explains the difficulty of avoiding sin in Kali Yuga, especially compared to the time of Yudhishthira, and the lack of means for the general population to perform sacrifices to atone for sins.

segments.key_quote: सम्सिद्धि, सम्सिद्धि means the highest perfection, is simply possible by pleasing the Lord Hari.
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes that the prime duty is to satisfy the Lord through occupational duty and recommended sacrifices, especially chanting the holy name of Krishna in Kali Yuga, which leads to freedom from sins and the highest perfection.

segments.key_quote: Chaitanya Mahaprabhu has taught us simply perform this Sankirtan Yagna and get the highest benefit.
segments.summary: The speaker highlights Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's teaching of Sankirtan Yagna as the most beneficial sacrifice in Kali Yuga, as it is simple and effective.

segments.key_quote: Just suitable for the age is the method recommended by Lord Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu in terms of the Shastra.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts the difficulty of performing traditional Yagnas requiring vast resources with the simplicity and effectiveness of chanting Hare Krishna as taught by Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, which requires no expenditure.

segments.key_quote: So therefore, it is recommended to chant the holy name of Supreme Lord Hari and easy, inexpensive, effective way of doing sacrifice in this age.
segments.summary: The speaker clarifies that animal sacrifices in Vedic times were different from modern slaughter, as the animals were rejuvenated by Vedic mantras chanted by qualified brahmanas, which is not possible today, making chanting the best sacrifice.
